title: Menu
content: The menu is visible after $isxboot$$ is done initializing. It shows a list of all configured entries in the configuration file.$n

content.title: Selecting and booting an entry
content: You can use the $iUP$$ and $iDOWN$$ arrow keys to select an entry. If you attempt to go below the last entry, you will get the option to create a
new entry. Note that any new entries will not be saved to the configuration file.$n$n
The selected entry is booted by pressing $iENTER$$.$nAlternatively, you can wait for the amount of time specified in the

content.title: Editing an entry
content: When pressing $iE$$, a list of all configured options of the selected entry will be shown. See $bRuntime Configuration$$ below.$n
You can also create a new temporary menu entry by going beyond the last listed entry and pressing $iE$$.

content.title: Runtime Configuration
content: After pressing $iE$$ on a menu entry, a list of all configured options will be shown.$n
Here, you can use the arrow keys to select an option or create a new option by going below the last entry. Press $iENTER$$ to edit the
selected option or press $iESCAPE$$ to return to the main menu.$n
A screen will be shown where you can edit the name ('key') or the value of the option. Select which one to edit by using the
$iUP$$ and $iDOWN$$ arrow keys. When finished editing, press $iENTER$$ to save the changes or press $iESCAPE$$ to cancel.$n
$bNote: $$You cannot edit the key for the option 'type' as that option is required for all entries and has a special meaning.$n
$bNote: $$Any changes made using this method are not saved to the configuration file and will only stay until the next reboot.
